intro: Ammannia dodecandra, commonly known as the redroot ammannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive red stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often near water bodies. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly serrated edge. Ammannia dodecandra is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
